short_summary: Reforestation services at the Chilcotin Military Training Area (CTA)
full_summary:
## Re-forestation Services at the Chilcotin Military Training Area (CTA)
### Overview
The Department of National Defence (DND) invites suppliers to submit a proposal for re-forestation services at the Chilcotin Military Training Area (CTA), located in central British Columbia, Canada. 

### Summary
This project aims to rehabilitate the forested land base at the CTA by planting reforestation seedlings in the spring season. The scope of work includes plans to plant approximately 900,000 seedlings across the property, scheduled for completion by the spring 2023 season. 

### Trade Agreements
This procurement is subject to several trade agreements, including:

*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO AGP)
*   Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
*   Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)

### Security Requirements
Security requirements are not applicable to this procurement.

### Site Visit
A mandatory site visit will be held on Thursday, September 29th, 2022, at 9:00 a.m. at the designated meeting location outside the gate at 1238 Stack Valley Road, Riske Creek, BC, V0L 1T0. Bidders are expected to confirm their attendance and provide the names of representatives who will attend. Bidders must also sign an attendance form.

### Contact Information
The contact person for this procurement is Karine Chretien, Indigenous Services Canada. She can be reached by email at [karine.chretien@canada.ca](mailto:karine.chretien@canada.ca) or by phone at (873) 354-6817. 

### Tender Documents
The tender documents, including amendments, questions and answers, and terms of the contract, are available for download at: [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca) under the reference number PW-22-01007786. 

### Vendor Information
The contracting authority is Indigenous Services Canada, with its head office located at 10 Wellington St., Gatineau, QC K1A 0H4. The,end user is Indigenous Services Canada.
